sub_title: Research Scientist at University of Twente, Founder of The Science Dev
summary:
I am a theoretical and computational condensed matter physicist and quantum chemist. I have 10 years of total research experience, with 6 years in scientific code development. 
I am proficient in Python, Fortran, and C++. I have expertise in version control, continuous integration, and deployment, and software build solutions.
I have theoretically formulated new methodologies and implemented them in leading open-source codes. I have authored 16 research articles, 1 book, and peer-reviewed 26 manuscripts.

treasury_media.title: Dr. Ravindra Shinde wins GCP for Research Award
treasury_media.description: Google Cloud Platform is a leading cloud service provider and has recently launched a program that enables academic researchers to perform research-related computations in the cloud using open-source codes. Dr. Ravindra Shinde's proposal of using Google Cloud to containerize quantum Monte Carlo code and libraries and making it available for users via web interfaces was awarded $4500 Google Cloud Credits.

awards.title: Google Cloud Platform Research Award
awards.description:
DR. RAVINDRA SHINDE WINS GOOGLE CLOUD FOR RESEARCH AWARD

Google Cloud Platform is a leading cloud service provider and has recently launched a program that enables academic researchers to perform research-related computations in the cloud using open-source codes. Dr. Ravindra Shinde's proposal of using Google Cloud to containerize quantum Monte Carlo code and libraries and making it available for users via web interfaces was awarded $4500 Google Cloud Credits.

profile_positions.description:
Leading software development for the TREX-CoE hosted at UT
Refactored legacy Fortran code to F08 standard;
Developed and implemented an MPI enabled Fortran based input file parser
Reengineered the data files parsing and output file formatting.
Plugins and preprocessing packages written in python and made available on PyPi and docker.
CI-CD using Github; Code documented using Doxygen.
profile_positions.title: HPC Code developer

profile_positions.description:
• I derived the mathematical formulation of the self-interaction corrections to the density functional theory for periodic and molecular systems; also implemented the theory in the open source code suite GPAW. 
• Performed ab initio molecular dynamics simulations for the degradation of hazardous pollutants PFAS. This work was highlighted by phys.org, Chemistry World and other news portals.
• Formulated and implemented a Gaussian laser pulse in GPAW code to do time-dependent density functional calculations to study the dissociation of hazardous molecules using the intense ultrafast laser.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• I investigated the ultrafast electron dynamics in 2D materials and quasi-2D heterostructures using TDDFT.
• Guided a subgroup to compute quasiparticle optical spectra and exciton energies in 2D heterostructures.
• Led another subgroup to computationally discover topologically exotic materials and investigated the pressure-induced topological phase transition. 
• Independently worked on machine learning for quantum chemical methods.
profile_positions.title: SERB National Postdoctoral Fellow

profile_positions.description: • Under this a semester-long contract position, I taught "Properties of Nanomaterials" to the 3rd year B.S-M.S integrated degree students. • I also supervised nanomaterials laboratory sessions and conducted a summer course on scientific computing. • Heavily emphasized on formative assessments and peer involvement.

profile_positions.description:
• During this postdoctoral stint, I worked as a code developer for the gnu-licensed TDDFT code -- OCTOPUS.
• Implemented the non-orthogonal lattice vectors functionality and a utility to port the supercell band structures to the band-unfolding code. 
• Computed linear optical absorption spectra of solids using meta-GGA functionals.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description:
• During the doctoral studies, I computed multi-reference configuration interaction optical absorption spectra of clusters. • Modified an existing code (MELD) to diagonalize huge Hamiltonian matrices.
• The single reference TDDFT functionals were benchmarked against the EOM-CCSD results. 
• Independently carried out hydrogen adsorption on beryllium oxide clusters for the purpose of solid-state hydrogen fuel storage.
profile_positions.title: CSIR Junior and Senior Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Worked on an experimental project involving a synthesis of a high-Tc superconductor (YBCO). The obtained Tc was around 78 K.
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Fellow

profile_positions.description: Worked on an experimental project involving the fragmentation and ionization of ethanol molecules under the influence of intense femtosecond laser. The fragmentation channels were identified and its variation with the various polarizations of laser were studied.
